intro: Boerhavia pedunculosa, commonly known as redroot sandplum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that produces small, pink to purple flowers. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Boerhavia pedunculosa is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
